segment.source: Planning to Deploy MBAM with Configuration Manager
segment.target: Planning to Deploy MBAM with Configuration Manager

segment.source: Planning to Deploy MBAM with Configuration Manager
segment.target: Planning to Deploy MBAM with Configuration Manager

segment.source: Planning to Deploy MBAM with Configuration Manager
segment.target: Planning to Deploy MBAM with Configuration Manager

segment.source: To deploy MBAM with the Configuration Manager topology, a three-server architecture, which supports 200,000 clients, is recommended.
segment.target: To deploy MBAM with the Configuration Manager topology, a three-server architecture, which supports 200,000 clients, is recommended.

segment.source: Use a separate server to run Configuration Manager, and install the basic Administration and Monitoring features on two servers, as shown in the architecture image in Getting Started - Using MBAM with Configuration Manager.
segment.target: Use a separate server to run Configuration Manager, and install the basic Administration and Monitoring features on two servers, as shown in the architecture image in Getting Started - Using MBAM with Configuration Manager.

segment.source: Windows To Go is not supported when you install the integrated topology of MBAM with Configuration Manager 2007.
segment.target: Windows To Go is not supported when you install the integrated topology of MBAM with Configuration Manager 2007.

segment.source: Deployment Prerequisites for Installing MBAM with Configuration Manager
segment.target: Deployment Prerequisites for Installing MBAM with Configuration Manager

segment.source: Ensure that you have met the following prerequisites before you install MBAM with Configuration Manager:
segment.target: Ensure that you have met the following prerequisites before you install MBAM with Configuration Manager:

segment.source: Ensure that the Configuration Manager Server is a primary site in the Configuration Manager system.
segment.target: Ensure that the Configuration Manager Server is a primary site in the Configuration Manager system.

segment.source: Enable the Hardware Inventory Client Agent on the Configuration Manager Server.
segment.target: Enable the Hardware Inventory Client Agent on the Configuration Manager Server.

segment.source: For Configuration Manager 2007, see How to Configure Hardware Inventory for a Site.
segment.target: For Configuration Manager 2007, see How to Configure Hardware Inventory for a Site.

segment.source: For System Center 2012 Configuration Manager, see How to Configure Hardware Inventory in Configuration Manager.
segment.target: For System Center 2012 Configuration Manager, see How to Configure Hardware Inventory in Configuration Manager.

segment.source: Enable the Desired Configuration Management (DCM) agent or the compliance settings, depending on the version of Configuration Manager that you are using.
segment.target: Enable the Desired Configuration Management (DCM) agent or the compliance settings, depending on the version of Configuration Manager that you are using.

segment.source: For Configuration Manager 2007, enable the see Desired Configuration Management Client Agent Properties.
segment.target: For Configuration Manager 2007, enable the see Desired Configuration Management Client Agent Properties.

segment.source: For System Center 2012 Configuration Manager, see Configuring Compliance Settings in Configuration Manager.
segment.target: For System Center 2012 Configuration Manager, see Configuring Compliance Settings in Configuration Manager.

segment.source: Define a reporting services point in Configuration Manager.
segment.target: Define a reporting services point in Configuration Manager.

segment.source: For Configuration Manager 2007, see How to Create a Reporting Services Point for SQL Reporting Services.
segment.target: For Configuration Manager 2007, see How to Create a Reporting Services Point for SQL Reporting Services.

segment.source: For System Center 2012 Configuration Manager, see Prerequisites for Reporting in Configuration Manager.
segment.target: For System Center 2012 Configuration Manager, see Prerequisites for Reporting in Configuration Manager.

segment.source: MBAM supports the following versions of Configuration Manager:
segment.target: MBAM supports the following versions of Configuration Manager:

segment.source: Microsoft System Center Configuration Manager 2007 R2
segment.target: Microsoft System Center Configuration Manager 2007 R2

segment.source: Although Configuration Manager 2007 is 32 bit, you must install it and SQL Server on a 64-bit operating system in order to match the 64-bit MBAM software.
segment.target: Although Configuration Manager 2007 is 32 bit, you must install it and SQL Server on a 64-bit operating system in order to match the 64-bit MBAM software.

segment.source: For a list of supported configurations for the Configuration Manager Server, see the appropriate webpage for the version of Configuration Manager that you are using.
segment.target: For a list of supported configurations for the Configuration Manager Server, see the appropriate webpage for the version of Configuration Manager that you are using.

segment.source: MBAM has no additional system requirements for the Configuration Manager Server.
segment.target: MBAM has no additional system requirements for the Configuration Manager Server.

segment.source: MBAM and SQL Server System Requirements
segment.target: MBAM and SQL Server System Requirements

segment.source: The supported configurations and system requirements for the MBAM servers and SQL Server for the Configuration Manager topology are the same as those for the Stand-alone topology.
segment.target: The supported configurations and system requirements for the MBAM servers and SQL Server for the Configuration Manager topology are the same as those for the Stand-alone topology.

segment.source: For the Stand-alone system requirements, see MBAM 2.0 Supported Configurations.
segment.target: For the Stand-alone system requirements, see MBAM 2.0 Supported Configurations.

segment.source: For the MBAM Server and SQL Server processor, RAM, and disk space requirements for the Configuration Manager topology, see the following sections.
segment.target: For the MBAM Server and SQL Server processor, RAM, and disk space requirements for the Configuration Manager topology, see the following sections.

segment.source: MBAM Server Processor, RAM, and Disk Space Requirements for MBAM
segment.target: MBAM Server Processor, RAM, and Disk Space Requirements for MBAM

segment.source: The following table lists the server processor, RAM, and disk space requirements for MBAM servers when you are using the Configuration Manager Integration topology.
segment.target: The following table lists the server processor, RAM, and disk space requirements for MBAM servers when you are using the Configuration Manager Integration topology.

segment.source: SQL Server Processor, RAM, and Disk Space Requirements
segment.target: SQL Server Processor, RAM, and Disk Space Requirements

segment.source: The following table lists the server processor, RAM, and disk space requirements for the SQL Server computer when you are using the Configuration Manager Integration topology.
segment.target: The following table lists the server processor, RAM, and disk space requirements for the SQL Server computer when you are using the Configuration Manager Integration topology.

segment.source: Required permissions to install the MBAM Server
segment.target: Required permissions to install the MBAM Server

segment.source: To install MBAM with Configuration Manager, you must have an administrative user in Configuration Manager who has a security role with the minimum permissions listed in the following table.
segment.target: To install MBAM with Configuration Manager, you must have an administrative user in Configuration Manager who has a security role with the minimum permissions listed in the following table.

segment.source: The table also shows the rights that you must have, beyond basic computer administrator rights, to install the MBAM Server.
segment.target: The table also shows the rights that you must have, beyond basic computer administrator rights, to install the MBAM Server.

segment.source: SQL instance Login Server Roles: - dbcreator- processadmin
segment.target: SQL instance Login Server Roles: - dbcreator- processadmin

segment.source: SQL Server Reporting Services instance rights: - Create Folders- Publish Reports
segment.target: SQL Server Reporting Services instance rights: - Create Folders- Publish Reports

segment.source: Configuration Manager collection rights: - Create- Delete- Read- Modify- Deploy Configuration Items
segment.target: Configuration Manager collection rights: - Create- Delete- Read- Modify- Deploy Configuration Items

segment.source: Configuration Manager configuration item rights: - Create- Delete- Read
segment.target: Configuration Manager configuration item rights: - Create- Delete- Read

segment.source: Configuration Manager collection rights: - Create- Delete- Read- ReadResource
segment.target: Configuration Manager collection rights: - Create- Delete- Read- ReadResource

segment.source: Configuration Manager configuration item rights: - Create- Delete- Read- Distribute
segment.target: Configuration Manager configuration item rights: - Create- Delete- Read- Distribute

segment.source: Order of Deployment of MBAM Features for the Configuration Manager Topology
segment.target: Order of Deployment of MBAM Features for the Configuration Manager Topology

segment.source: When deploying MBAM on the Configuration Manager Server, you must complete the deployment tasks in the following order:
segment.target: When deploying MBAM on the Configuration Manager Server, you must complete the deployment tasks in the following order:

segment.source: Edit the configuration.mof file on the Configuration Manager Server.
segment.target: Edit the configuration.mof file on the Configuration Manager Server.

segment.source: Create or edit the smsdef.mof file Configuration Manager Server.
segment.target: Create or edit the smsdef.mof file Configuration Manager Server.

segment.source: Install MBAM on the Configuration Manager Server.
segment.target: Install MBAM on the Configuration Manager Server.

segment.source: Install the Recovery Database and the Audit Database on the Database server.
segment.target: Install the Recovery Database and the Audit Database on the Database server.

segment.source: Install the MBAM features on the Administration and Monitoring Server.
segment.target: Install the MBAM features on the Administration and Monitoring Server.

segment.source: Planning Checklist for Installing MBAM with Configuration Manager
segment.target: Planning Checklist for Installing MBAM with Configuration Manager

segment.source: This checklist outlines the recommended steps and a high-level list of items to consider when planning for an Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring deployment with Configuration Manager.
segment.target: This checklist outlines the recommended steps and a high-level list of items to consider when planning for an Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring deployment with Configuration Manager.

segment.source: It is recommended that you copy this checklist into a spreadsheet program and customize it for your use.
segment.target: It is recommended that you copy this checklist into a spreadsheet program and customize it for your use.

segment.source: Review the getting started information, which describes how Configuration Manager works with MBAM and shows the recommended high-level architecture.
segment.target: Review the getting started information, which describes how Configuration Manager works with MBAM and shows the recommended high-level architecture.

segment.source: Getting Started - Using MBAM with Configuration Manager
segment.target: Getting Started - Using MBAM with Configuration Manager

segment.source: Review the planning information, which describes the deployment prerequisites, supported configurations, required permissions, and deployment order for each feature.
segment.target: Review the planning information, which describes the deployment prerequisites, supported configurations, required permissions, and deployment order for each feature.

segment.source: Planning to Deploy MBAM with Configuration Manager
segment.target: Planning to Deploy MBAM with Configuration Manager

segment.source: Plan for and configure MBAM Group Policy requirements.
segment.target: Plan for and configure MBAM Group Policy requirements.

segment.source: Planning for MBAM 2.0 Group Policy Requirements
segment.target: Planning for MBAM 2.0 Group Policy Requirements

segment.source: Plan for and create necessary Active Directory Domain Services security groups and plan for MBAM local security group membership requirements.
segment.target: Plan for and create necessary Active Directory Domain Services security groups and plan for MBAM local security group membership requirements.

segment.source: Plan for deploying MBAM Client deployment.
segment.target: Plan for deploying MBAM Client deployment.
